intro: Porochna bifolia, commonly known as the two-leaved porochna, is a lesser-known species within the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive bifoliate leaves, which are divided into two lobes, giving it a unique appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Porochna bifolia is noted for its aromatic properties, though it is not widely cultivated or utilized in traditional medicine.
